notes: Leone marketed as DL/GL in North America. Available in multiple body styles. Front-wheel drive or part-time/full-time four-wheel drive. Turbocharged variants available in 1980s. Established Subaru's AWD reputation. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Leone article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Bi-drive Recreational All-terrain Transporter (BRAT) compact pickup with open bed. Famous for rear-facing jump seats in bed to circumvent chicken tax. Available with FWD or part-time 4WD. Cult classic with strong following. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru BRAT article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Subcompact hatchback with three-cylinder engine. One of first production vehicles with CVT transmission (ECVT - Electro Continuously Variable Transmission). Available with FWD or part-time 4WD. Fuel-efficient economy car. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Justy article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Sports coupe with wedge-shaped design and aircraft-inspired interior. Available with four-cylinder or flat-six engines. Digital instrumentation. Asymmetric steering wheel. Pop-up headlights. Unique and futuristic for its era. Difficulty modifier reflects flat-six engine complexity on XT6 models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru XT article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation Legacy launched late 1989 as 1990 model. Replaced Leone as midsize offering. Available with FWD or AWD. Modern design and improved refinement. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Legacy article, December 19, 2024 revision.
